intro: Vietnamia inflexa, commonly known as the Vietnamese sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils and is adapted to saline environments. Vietnamia inflexa is often found in coastal dunes and is a valuable species for stabilizing sandy soils. Its ecological importance lies in its ability to thrive in harsh, coastal conditions.
